title: Drawing, "Elevation of a Stand and Incense Burner", 1775
medium: Pen and brush and black ink, wash, black chalk on white laid paper
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum, New York, stamp 457e
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink in margin lower left: J.E.D.; on verso in center: 133
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Smoke rises from the socket-shaped vessel on top of a stand, which is decorated with rams' heads, fruit  festoons, and drapery.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Elevation of a Stand and Incense Burner", 1775.
1775. Pen and brush and black ink, wash, black chalk on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-51.
